questions.text: A clinical researcher is conducting a study on the thermal comfort of patients in a hospital ward. To evaluate the average temperature from all surfaces surrounding the patients, which instrument should the researcher use?
Which of the following cylindrical lens combinations can be used to cure astigmatism that follows the rule?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) -3.00 DC x 180, +1.00 DC x 90

 

Astigmatism that "follows the rule" (or "with-the-rule" astigmatism) refers to a condition where the vertical meridian (90 degrees) has more refractive power than the horizontal meridian (180 degrees). In other words, with-the-rule astigmatism requires more correction along the horizontal axis (180 degrees) and less along the vertical axis (90 degrees).

 

To correct with-the-rule astigmatism:

 

  • The lens should have a minus (negative) cylindrical power at 180 degrees (horizontal axis).
  • A plus (positive) cylindrical power at 90 degrees (vertical axis) can also be used to balance the refractive power needed along each axis.

 

In this case:

 

  • -3.00 DC x 180, +1.00 DC x 90 follows the rule. The negative cylindrical power at 180 degrees and the positive cylindrical power at 90 degrees appropriately address with-the-rule astigmatism.

 

Educational Objective:

 

With-the-rule astigmatism correction typically requires a negative cylindrical lens power at 180 degrees and a positive cylindrical lens power at 90 degrees to compensate for the natural curvature of the cornea.

questions.text: A 72-year-old man came with headache and blurring of vision. Kidney function tests were found to be deranged and his urine gammaglobulins were more than 3gm/dI. Electrophoresis of the urine protein is shown below. Which is the most likely diagnosis?

A tissue sample shows significant cellular damage. Which of the following changes is most indicative of irreversible cell injury in the sample?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Amorphous density of mitochondria

 

Amorphous densities in mitochondria are characteristic features of irreversible cell injury. These densities represent calcium phosphate deposits within damaged mitochondria, which occur as the mitochondrial membrane becomes increasingly permeable during severe cell injury. When mitochondria are severely damaged, they can no longer maintain calcium homeostasis, leading to calcium influx and the formation of these dense deposits. 

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Cellular swelling: This is an early change that can be seen in both reversible and irreversible cell injury. It occurs due to the failure of the sodium-potassium pump resulting in sodium accumulation within the cell, followed by water influx. Since this is a nonspecific finding that can be present in both reversible and irreversible injury, it's not the most indicative of irreversible damage.

 

Option B. Bleb formation: Blebs are outpouchings of the plasma membrane that form due to focal weakening of the cytoskeleton. Like cellular swelling, bleb formation can be seen in both reversible and irreversible cell injury, so it's not specifically indicative of irreversible damage.

 

Option D. Cytoplasmic vacuolation: Vacuoles can form in the cytoplasm during cell injury due to dilation of the endoplasmic reticulum or increased autophagy. This change is commonly seen in reversible cell injury and is therefore not the most reliable indicator of irreversible damage.

 

Educational Objective:

 

The presence of amorphous densities in mitochondria is a morphological feature that indicates irreversible cell injury, distinguishing it from changes that can be seen in both reversible and irreversible injury such as cellular swelling, bleb formation, and cytoplasmic vacuolation.

questions.solution: Ans. D) A-4, B-3, C-1, D-2

questions.text:
What investigations would you perform to calculate the power of the intraocular lens to be implanted for cataract surgery?

 

  1. Biometry
  2. Pachymetry
  3. Tonometry
  4. Keratometry
  5. Gonioscopy

A young female patient presented to the outpatient department with burning micturition and greenish-frothy vaginal discharge. Her past history revealed that she underwent mechanical heart valve replacement surgery and is currently undergoing warfarin therapy for transient ischemic attacks. The next day, she presents with complaints of excessive bleeding after a trivial injury. Which of the following drugs was most probably prescribed?

choices.text: Occurs within 24 hours of penicillin therapy in syphilis
Due to lipoprotein release causing cytokine storm
Corticosteroids are indicated in pregnant women and neurosyphilis
It is a contraindication to penicillin therapy

questions.text: All are true regarding Jarisch–Herxheimer reaction, except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) It is a contraindication to penicillin therapy

questions.text: A 63-year-old man with longstanding seropositive rheumatoid arthritis presents with progressive dyspnea and mild pleuritic chest pain. He denies fever or cough. Chest X-ray reveals bilateral pleural effusions. Thoracentesis yields a cloudy, milky-appearing fluid. Pleural fluid analysis shows protein 4.5 g/dL, cholesterol 280 mg/dL, triglycerides 35 mg/dL, and presence of cholesterol crystals. Gram stain and culture are negative, and there is no neutrophilic predominance. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A G3P2 woman with BMI -40 is in active labor. Following the delivery of the fetal head, the anterior shoulder is impacted behind the pubic symphysis, which of the following maneuvers is being performed in this scenario?

A 52-year-old man presents with complaints of fatigue and early satiety. bone marrow Biopsy is performed, and electron microscopy of one of the abnormal cells is shown in the image. Which of the following best identifies the cell shown?

choices.text: Prevention of Parent to Child Transmission
Prime Minister’s Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nourishment

questions.text: Identify the program shown in the image based on the logo displayed.
questions.solution: Ans. D) Prime Minister’s Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nourishment

questions.text:
Which of the following are indications for early clamping of umbilical cord at delivery?

  1. Rh incompatibility
  2. Baby born to a diabetic mother
  3. Maternal anemia
  4. Birth asphyxia

A 59-year-old man from Pune with a known history of alcohol-related cirrhosis presents to the emergency department with increasing confusion, low-grade fever, and abdominal discomfort over the last 2 days. On examination, he is drowsy, oriented only to place, has flapping tremors, and a tense, distended abdomen. There is no history of hematemesis or GI bleeding. Laboratory tests reveal serum bilirubin 6.4 mg/dL and creatinine 1.2 mg/dL. Diagnostic paracentesis is performed, and the fluid appears clear. Ascitic fluid analysis has been performed and the report is shown below:

 

 

What is the most appropriate treatment?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Cefotaxime and IV albumin

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with locally advanced cervical cancer (Stage IIA) is planned for surgical management. The oncologist decides to perform a radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy, which involves removal of the uterus, parametrial tissue, and upper vagina. According to the Piver-Rutledge classification, which type of hysterectomy is this?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Type III - Meigs Hysterectomy

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with a BMI of 37 kg/m² and no history of diabetes is being evaluated for pharmacologic therapy for obesity. Despite structured dietary changes and physical activity for the past 6 months, she has only achieved 2% weight loss. She now seeks medical treatment to maximize further reduction. Among the FDA-approved options, which of the following medications has demonstrated the greatest average weight loss in clinical trials?

A 23-year-old male presents with a lifelong history of easy bruising and mucosal bleeding. He reports frequent nosebleeds and prolonged bleeding after minor cuts. Platelet count is normal. What is the most likely underlying defect responsible for this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Gp Ib/IX complex deficiency

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the fertility clinic with a history of azoospermia and primary infertility for 3 years. Hormonal analysis shows normal testosterone and FSH levels, and ultrasound reveals bilateral normal-sized testes with dilated epididymal tubules, suggesting obstructive azoospermia. The reproductive specialist plans a procedure to aspirate sperm directly from the testes for assisted reproductive techniques. Which of the following is the most appropriate sperm retrieval method in this patient?

In preparing for a state-level deployment of vaccines, Logistic manager must decide on the best equipment to use for storing the OPV vaccine for long term. What would be the recommended choice at the state/regional level?

A 27-year-old man with schizophrenia comes to the emergency department due to an acute muscle spasm in his neck that developed several days after starting treatment with haloperidol. He is extremely distressed and unable to turn his head. The patient is treated with intravenous diphenhydramine, which relieves his symptoms within minutes. A psychiatrist is consulted, and recommendations are made to discontinue haloperidol and start the second-generation antipsychotic quetiapine because of its lower risk for similar dystonic side effects. In addition to dopamine D2 receptor antagonism, this new medication has which of the following pharmacological properties?
A public health engineer is designing a sanitary well for a rural community to ensure safe drinking water. What is the minimum depth required for the lining of a sanitary well?

Which of the following contribute to onset of labour?

  1. Uterine distension
  2. Increased CRH & ACTH from fetal HPA axis
  3. Increased progesterone levels immediately before labour
  4. Increased oxytocin receptors secondary to estrogen

choices.text: A-ring occurs at the proximal cricopharyngeus
B-ring occurs at the squamocolumnar junction and corresponds to the gastroesophageal junction.
A-ring is always symptomatic and associated with dysphagia.
Schatzki ring is associated with achalasia

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding esophageal rings is true?
questions.solution: Ans. B) B-ring occurs at the squamocolumnar junction and corresponds to the gastroesophageal junction.

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of delamanid in the treatment of tuberculosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis

questions.text: A patient who had undergone knee replacement surgery 7 days back now presents with complaints of sudden shortness of breath and tachycardia. What is the next appropriate diagnostic test?

choices.text: Failure of ventral pancreatic bud to rotate
Failure of fusion between dorsal and ventral pancreatic ducts
Persistence of both dorsal buds forming an annular pancreas
Early fusion of pancreatic buds with duplication of the main duct

questions.text: A 28-year-old man presents with recurrent episodes of acute pancreatitis. MRCP is shown. Which of the following best explains this anomaly?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Failure of fusion between dorsal and ventral pancreatic ducts

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents with seizures and cortical mass on imaging. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 40-year-old patient presents with recurrent red-eye, pain, and blurry vision. The image is shown below. What is the most likely finding?

choices.text: Inhibitors are unreactive until within the enzyme’s active site.
It is an irreversible form of enzyme inhibition that occurs when an enzyme binds to a substrate analogue and forms an irreversible complex through a covalent bond.
Inhibitor binds to all sites resulting in irreversible inhibition.
The inhibitor binds to the active site where it is modified by the enzyme to form a stable inhibitor–enzyme complex.

questions.text: Which of the following statements concerning suicidal inhibition is incorrect?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Inhibitor binds to all sites resulting in irreversible inhibition.

questions.text: Which of the following is a contraindication for bisphosphonate therapy?

Which of the following statements have obstetric significance at the level of the plane of least pelvic dimensions?

  1. It is a landmark used for pudendal nerve block analgesia.
  2. Deep transverse arrest usually occurs at this plane.
  3. It is at this plane that the internal rotation of the fetal head occurs during labour.
  4. It marks the beginning of the backward curve of the pelvic axis.

choices.text: Mediates chylomicron secretion into lymphatics – ApoB48

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.solution: Ans. A) Activation of LCAT – ApoAII

choices.text: Lesions of the same age throughout the artery

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman diagnosed with polyarteritis nodosa presents with abdominal pain, bloody stools, and hypertension. Which of the following is not typically found in histopathological examination of the affected vessels?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Lesions of the same age throughout the artery

questions.text: The mean systolic blood pressure was measured in a sample population of elderly females as 125 mmHg with a standard deviation of 10. 95% of people would have blood pressure above:

Which of the following is not classified as an OCD-related disorder?

A 9-year-old boy has short stature, webbed neck, widely spaced nipples, cryptorchidism, and pulmonary valve stenosis. Karyotype is 46,XY. Intelligence is mildly affected. Which gene mutation is most likely?

A 33-year-old gravida 3 para 2 woman at 39 weeks gestation is in the labor and delivery unit. After delivering her baby, the obstetric resident begins to deliver the placenta. During this procedure, she observes that the uterine fundus is not palpable in the suprapubic region. What complication is most likely to result?
Which nerve is most likely affected, based on the hand posture shown in the image?
Which of the following physicians is/are not permitted to proclaim brainstem death under the Transplantation of Human Organs Act?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Surgeon doing liver transplant

choices.text: 5 litres in the first 8 hours
10 litres in the next 16 hours
10 litres in the first 8 hours
5 litres in the next 24 hours

questions.text: A 40-year-old female patient presents with 50% second-degree burns. She weighs 100 kgs. Which of the following is true regarding fluid resuscitation in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. A) 5 litres in the first 8 hours

questions.text: A 76-year-old male presents with chronic, progressive abdominal discomfort over the past year. Cross-sectional imaging reveals a 10 cm pancreatic mass. Histological examination of the biopsy specimen confirms pancreatic adenocarcinoma, and molecular analysis identifies inactivation of the SMAD4 gene. Alteration in which of the following regulatory pathways is most likely responsible for the pathogenesis of this tumor?

A study was done to investigate whether three new antibiotics used for urinary tract infections cured the disease or not. Which of the following statistical tests can be used to test the significance of this study?

choices.text: Immediate enucleation of the injured eye

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman undergoes enucleation of her left eye following a severe penetrating injury sustained in a car accident. Two months later, she develops photophobia, blurring of vision, and floaters in her right eye. On examination, she has retrolental flare, vitreous cells, and clusters of pigmented epithelioid cells beneath the retinal pigment epithelium. What is the most appropriate next step in management?

A 25-year-old patient came to the OPD after a fall on his hand. He is now experiencing pain in the hand region. The X-ray of the patient is given below. Identify the type of joint marked in the X-ray?

A middle-aged woman presents with progressive lower limb weakness, spasticity, and new-onset micturition hesitancy. MRI shows a mid-dorsal intradural-extramedullary contrast-enhancing mass lesion. What is the most likely diagnosis?

choices.text: Toxicity is due to accumulation of p-aminophenol
Toxic metabolite N-acetyl-p-benzoquinone imine (NAPQI) is detoxified by conjugation with glutathione
N-acetyl cysteine acts by inhibiting cytochrome P450

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding paracetamol toxicity is true?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Toxic metabolite N-acetyl-p-benzoquinone imine (NAPQI) is detoxified by conjugation with glutathione

questions.text: A 20-year-old male with repeated lung infections presents with the following CXR. Which organism is most commonly associated with his respiratory disease?

choices.text: Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; extends the knee
Extends, adducts, and medially rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee
Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee
Extends, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; extends the knee

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the action of the sartorius muscle?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee

questions.text: Which of the following snakes is not typically covered by the standard polyvalent snake antivenoms?

choices.text: They are not effective in children below 2 years of age
They act via T-cell dependent mechanism

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding conjugate vaccines?
questions.solution: Ans. A) They are not effective in children below 2 years of age

questions.text: What is the ideal maintenance fluid of choice in children?
questions.solution: Ans. B) 5% Dextrose and Normal Saline

questions.text: Which of the following correctly matches the antibody type and site of hemolysis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Cold hemolysin – IgG – intravascular

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents because of a 6-week history of increased tiredness, irritability, and worsening leg pain. Examination shows conjunctival pallor and diffuse petechiae. There are palpable, nontender posterior cervical and axillary lymph nodes. His hemoglobin concentration is 8.9 g/dL, leukocyte count is 45,750/mm3, and platelet count is 25,000/mm3. A bone marrow aspiration shows numerous immature cells that stain positive for CD10, CD19, and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TT). Which of the following translocations is associated with a favorable prognosis for this patient's condition?

choices.text: Normal fetal response during active labor

questions.text: A 30-year-old primigravida at 39 weeks gestation is undergoing continuous electronic fetal monitoring during labor. The fetal heart rate tracing pattern is shown below. Which of the following conditions is most commonly associated with the pattern seen in this tracing?
A 30-year-old primigravida at 32 weeks gestation undergoes a routine obstetric ultrasound. Which of the following best describes this abnormal placental finding?
An illustration of two graphs (A and B) that represent the affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen is shown. Which of the following best explains a shift from A to B?

In a public health survey conducted in rural Odisha, a 36-year-old woman is found to have a hemoglobin (Hb) level of 15.0 g/dl. This finding is particularly noteworthy as the survey data shows that the mean Hb level among the women in this area is 13.5 g/dl, with a standard deviation of 1.5 g/dl. To contextualize the woman's Hb level within the study's data, the researcher uses the concept of Z-scores. Based on this information, what is the Z-score for this woman's hemoglobin level?
Which of the following mechanisms contributes to the impedance matching of the middle ear?
questions.solution: Ans. D) All of the above

choices.text: Vitreous to posterior capsule of lens

questions.text: The hyaloideo-capsular ligament of Weigert connects which of the following structures?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Vitreous to posterior capsule of lens

questions.text: A new screening test for detecting cervical cancer is being studied in a group of 100 women. 60 women tested negative and 40 tested positive. Among the women who tested positive by the new test, 30 were positive and among the women who tested negative, 10 were having the disease. What is the positive predictive value of the test?

choices.text: Conventional PCR with Restriction Fragment Length Pair Technique

questions.text: Which of the following methods is most appropriate for quantitative analysis of the viral RNA genome?
questions.solution: Ans. A) RT-PCR followed by Real-time PCR

questions.text: A 65-year-old male with benign prostatic hyperplasia is planned for a prostatectomy. The most commonly used approach involves resection via a retropubic approach. Which of the following is the correct term for this procedure?

choices.text: Oedema and cystic changes in the stria vascularis
Vasoconstriction of small vessels in the cochlea

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a history of hypertension and chronic heart failure is prescribed furosemide for his condition. After several weeks of treatment, he notices a gradual loss of hearing. Which of the following mechanisms is most likely responsible for his hearing impairment?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Oedema and cystic changes in the stria vascularis

questions.text:
A 16-year-old girl with primary amenorrhea has the following features. What is the most probable diagnosis?

 

  • Normal stature
  • Thelarche – absent
  • FSH, LH – high
  • Karyotype - 46 XX
All are correct regarding good prognostic indicators in PTSD, except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Gradual onset of symptoms

questions.text: Which one of the following complications of chronic kidney disease is observed in patients with low parathyroid hormone levels?
